ANU.name: George Wilson
expertise: Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Environmental Knowledge
interest: Conservation and improved animal welfare through sustainable wildlife use on the rangelands.Indigenous land and wildlife managementVeterinary conservation biology and aerial surveysCarbon management and production of low emission kangaroo meat
ANU.biography: He has many years’ experience and skills as a wildlife veterinarian and in tranquilising wild animals. He has held many honorary positions including as Commissioner Emeritus with the IUCN Species Survival Commission in recognition of his chairmanship of the Australian Marsupial Specialist Group.
project: Kangaroo welfare, reduced land degradation, identification of carbon saving, biodiversity benefits and Indigenous opportunities
Mapping the distribution and abundance of kangaroos and predicting densities in unsurveyed areas
Applying Market Economics to Conservation of Australian Wildlife – landowner opportunities from southern African experiences
Scientific support for Indigenous Protected Areas
Improving Indigenous Land Management Governance; How Indigenous Directors and Board members might be better equipped to deal with the financial and management responsibilities placed on them
